trans-unit.source: Contains the basic elements of a management object.
It serves as a base class to more specific management object classes.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementBaseObject"></xref> class that is serializable.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination (see <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> ) for this serialization.
Gets the path to the management object's class.
Property Value
A <xref:System.Management.ManagementPath> that represents the path to the management object's class.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Management.ManagementPath"></xref> that contains the class path to the management object's class.
Returns a copy of the object.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The new cloned object.
Compares this object to another, based on specified options.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The object to which to compare this object.
Options on how to compare the objects.
`true` if the objects compared are equal according to the given options; otherwise, `false`.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the ManagementBaseObject.
Compares two management objects.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
An object to compare with this instance.
`true` if this is an instance of <xref href="System.Management.ManagementBaseObject"></xref> and represents the same object as this instance; otherwise, `false`.
Serves as a hash function for a particular type, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A hash code for the current object.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with the data necessary to deserialize the field represented by this instance.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination (see <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> ) for this serialization.
Returns the value of the specified property qualifier.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The name of the property to which the qualifier belongs.
The name of the property qualifier of interest.
The value of the specified qualifier.
Gets an equivalent accessor to a property's value.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The name of the property of interest.
The value of the specified property.
Gets the value of the specified qualifier.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The name of the qualifier of interest.
The value of the specified qualifier.
Returns a textual representation of the object in the specified format.
Currently, the only format that WMI supports is *Managed Object Format* (MOF).
In the future, other formats will be supported, such as Extensible Markup Language (XML).
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The requested textual format.
The textual representation of the object in the specified format.
Gets access to property values through [] notation.
This property is the indexer for the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementBaseObject"></xref> class.
You can use the default indexed properties defined by a type, but you cannot explicitly define your own.
However, specifying the **expando** attribute on a class automatically provides a default indexed property whose type is Object and whose index type is String.
Property Value
An object instance that contains the value of the requested property.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The name of the property of interest.
Returns an <xref href="System.Object"></xref> value that contains the management object for a specific class property.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Management.PropertyData"></xref> objects describing the properties of the management object.
Property Value
A <xref:System.Management.PropertyDataCollection> that represents the properties of the management object.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Management.PropertyDataCollection"></xref> that holds the properties for the management object.
Gets the collection of <xref href="System.Management.QualifierData"></xref> objects defined on the management object.
Each element in the collection holds information such as the *qualifier* name, value, and *flavor*.
Property Value
A <xref:System.Management.QualifierDataCollection> that represents the qualifiers defined on the management object.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Management.QualifierDataCollection"></xref> that holds the qualifiers for the management object.
Sets the value of the specified property qualifier.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The name of the property to which the qualifier belongs.
The name of the property qualifier of interest.
The new value for the qualifier.
Sets the value of the named property.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The name of the property to be changed.
The new value for this property.
Sets the value of the named qualifier.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The name of the qualifier to set.
This parameter cannot be null.
The value to set.
Gets the collection of WMI system properties of the management object (for example, the class name, server, and namespace).
WMI system property names begin with "__".
Property Value
A <xref:System.Management.PropertyDataCollection> that represents the system properties of the management object.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Management.PropertyDataCollection"></xref> that contains the system properties for a management object.
Implements the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable"></xref> interface and returns the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementBaseObject"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> containing the information required to serialize the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementBaseObject"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> containing the source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementBaseObject"></xref>.
info is `null`.
